org.hibernate.ogm.dialect.eventstate.impl

Class EventContextManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.hibernate.ogm.dialect.eventstate.impl.EventContextManager
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, Service

    public class EventContextManager
extends Object
implements Service
    A service which provides access to state specific to one event cycle (currently (auto)-flush or persist).

    Client code (such as persisters, dialects etc.) may use this service to propagate state amongst each other, as long as they are within the same event cycle. States are identified by class objects which are used as key when accessing the contextual map. If a given state type is accessed for the first time during an event cycle, its associated EventStateLifecycle will be invoked to obtain a new instance of that state type.

    Accessing the context when not being within the scope of a supported event cycle is illegal.

    The service state is managed by listeners such as EventContextManagingAutoFlushEventListener which make sure that the context is destroyed upon event cycle completion.

    Author:
    Gunnar Morling
    See Also:

        public boolean isActive()
